en.title: Filming for the browser
en.excerpt: Notes on compressing cinematic footage without losing atmosphere on the web.
en.body:
When filming for the browser, I start with the final delivery bitrate and colour space in mind so there are no surprises during grading.

My typical flow: capture in Blackmagic RAW, grade to REC.709 in DaVinci Resolve, export as ProRes, then compress to AV1 or VP9 with ffmpeg and Squoosh before shipping.

I also share mobile testing notes, including how I pair Lottie with video fallbacks to keep motion smooth across devices.

zh.title: 為瀏覽器而拍攝
zh.excerpt: 記錄如何壓縮電影感影像，同時保留在網頁上的氛圍。
zh.body:
在為網頁拍攝影片時，我會先設定最終輸出的資料率與色彩空間，再回推到拍攝流程。這樣可以避免後期調光時才發現細節遺失。

我常用的流程是：以 Blackmagic RAW 拍攝、在 DaVinci Resolve 調整成 REC.709，接著輸出成 ProRes。進入網頁前，再用 ffmpeg 與 Squoosh 將檔案壓縮成 AV1 或 VP9。

文章也分享我在不同裝置測試時的心得，包括如何設定 Lottie 與 video fallback，確保動畫與影片在行動裝置仍然順暢。
